channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Temasek, Sequoia Capital, Softbank and 15 VCs face lawsuit for “abating” FTX fraud
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The lawsuit alleged that these VC firms made many deceptive and misleading statements about FTX while encouraging customers to invest in the exchange for their personal gain.

item.title: FTX’s former law firm hit with lawsuit alleging it set up shadowy entities
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The suit claims “shadowy entities” set up by Fenwick & West were allegedly used by FTX and former top executives to misappropriate customer funds.

item.title: Cardano DEX MuesliSwap to refund users after slippage confusion
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The MuesliSwap team wants to refund users who have lost funds to high slippage due to the way the DEX’s matchmaker was set up.

item.title: Blockchain Capital’s X account hacked to promote token claim scam
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The account made multiple posts promising a token giveaway and ushered users to a copycat website to connect their crypto wallet.

item.title: BlackRock insiders say Bitcoin ETF is likely 6 months away: Novogratz
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: “We’re going to fight like cats and dogs to win market share” once spot Bitcoin ETFs are approved, Galaxy Digital CEO Mike Novogratz told shareholders.

item.title: US Fed steps up oversight of banks' involvement with crypto firms
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The limitations set out in the Federal Reserve’s new Novel Activities Supervision Program provides additional measures to its original policy statement laid out in January.

item.title: Marathon Digital Q2 results miss revenue and earnings forecasts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Despite the earnings miss, Marathon's CEO said it mined a record 2,926 Bitcoin over the second quarter of 2023.

item.title: Core Scientific’s bankruptcy plan includes equity stake for Bitmain and Anchorage
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: If the plan is approved, Core Scientific could buy 27,000 Bitmain miners for roughly $23 million in cash and $54 million in company equity.

item.title: ChatGPT and Claude are ‘becoming capable of tackling real-world missions,’ say scientists
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The scientists developed a tool called "AgentBench" to benchmark LLM models as agents.

item.title: Bitstamp to suspend trading of major altcoins for US users
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: All the soon-to-be-suspended tokens are alleged by the SEC to be securities in its lawsuit against Coinbase and Binance.

item.title: Former FTX exec Ryan Salame and US prosecutors are discussing a plea deal: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: It’s unclear whether any reported guilty plea from Ryan Salame would have the former FTX Digital Markets co-CEO testify at Sam Bankman-Fried's trial in October.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price stuck?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.category: why is bitcoin price not moving
item.description: Bitcoin price is stuck today, but several data points suggest it won’t be for too much longer

item.title: Prosecutors will still consider Sam Bankman-Fried’s alleged campaign finance scheme at trial
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Rather than reinstating a count on campaign finance violations to SBF’s indictment, the Justice Department said it will consider the evidence as part of a wire fraud charge.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: CPI report may show uptick in US inflation — How will Bitcoin price react?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Bitcoin’s price remains range-bound as equities, gold and U.S. Treasurys offer competitive rates with reduced risk. This week’s CPI report could shake things up.

item.title: Futurama’s latest reboot takes aim at Bitcoin miners
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The latest episode of the series, which first premiered in 1999, would have its audience believe humans (and robots) will still be mining Bitcoin in the year 3023.

item.title: Reddit community tokens soar on Kraken listing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The tokens are part of the Reddit Community Points initiative to create cryptocurrencies that would incentivize content creation.

item.title: USDC issuer Circle launches MPC wallet beta for Ethereum, Polygon, Avalanche
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The stablecoin issuer launched a service and API that allows developers to create customized wallets for their users.

item.title: Can Cardano whales stop ADA price from falling 20%?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: The amount of ADA being held by Cardano's richest investors has surged to its highest level in almost a year.

item.title: Coinbase begins $150M debt buyback at 36% discount
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The cryptocurrency exchange’s 2031 senior notes, which have a coupon rate of 3.625%, have $1 billion in outstanding principal.

item.title: 10 obstacles to cross-chain interoperability (and how they can be overcome)
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Innovation Circle
item.description: Cross-chain operability may only be achieved when there’s not only a way, but a will to move forward.

item.title: Free Bitcoin on Zaps experiment — but what are Zaps?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joe Hall
item.description: Why a Canadian Bitcoin advocate is giving out free Bitcoin tips, or Zaps, to people around the globe — and why the Zap trend is catching on.

item.title: Binance receives licenses to offer crypto services in El Salvador
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The exchange reported receiving approval for Bitcoin Services Provider and Digital Assets Services Provider licenses in El Salvador, where Bitcoin has been legal tender since 2021.

item.title: Obligatory license for stablecoins? What do the latest FSB guidelines mean
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: FSB starts from the definition of “global stablecoin”, which serves as a means of payment and storage and has the potential for adoption across multiple jurisdictions.

item.title: Should you just wait for October to trade Bitcoin?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Nibley
item.description: The months of August and September haven’t been the best for the Bitcoin price historically, and with volatility at historic lows, traders may want to wait it out.

item.title: Japanese startup to use stablecoins and CBDC to link Asian countries
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Soramitsu is developing a cross-border payment system that uses Cambodia’s CBDC and targets Japan, India, China and Southeast Asia.

item.title: Bitcoin phone home: Use crypto to buy sim cards in 140 countries with Bitrefill
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joe Hall
item.description: Bitcoin and crypto travelers can bid farewell to telco woes with Bitrefill’s eSims, now available in 140 countries.

item.title: Disney creates an AI task force to explore the tech and cut costs: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Disney has reportedly created a task force for studying how it can incorporate AI into its operations, sources close to the matter told Reuters.

item.title: How self-sovereign identity helps users own their data
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Shiba Inu lead developer Shytoshi Kusama recently unveiled plans to integrate self-sovereign identity into its projects.

item.title: Bank of England will get more power in regulating stablecoins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The United Kingdom government could rebalance the power between the Bank of England and the country’s principal financial regulator, the Financial Conduct Authority.
